snippet: The civil war has exacted a brutal toll, yet at a funeral for a soldier from a coastal town, grief was tempered with loyalty for the government.
abstract: Daqaqa Journal; residents of Daqaqa, Syria, mourn death of Abu Lavth, 24-year-old Syrian Army lieutenant who is first village casualty in ongoing conflict; Daqaqa is in coastal Latakia province, where support for Pres Bashar al-Assad remains strong and village's grief is tempered by loyalty to government.

byline.contributor: Andrea Bruce and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The civil war has exacted a brutal toll, yet at a funeral for a soldier from a coastal town, grief was tempered with loyalty for the government.

headline.print_headline: Mourning Syrian Soldier, but Not Doubting a War
headline.main: Mourning Syrian Soldier, but Not Doubting a War

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
